A reggae song, Rivers of Babylon, is heard playing in Jack’s limo on an style tape portable player.

(after a pause) «+I think you should.

Yeah.

Pull it out of the way. And don’t be all day.

An attendant stands by the opulent wash basins. Clyde finishes at a urinal and moves to wash his hands. The attendant offers Clyde a squeeze of a French hand soap fr fancy looking bottle. Clyde washes his hands. The attenda smiles and readies a towel. Clyde dries his hands. After another moment of the two men looking at one another, mor less expressionless, Clyde takes some change out of his pocket.
No coins. The attendant steps back. Clyde puts a buck in a tip bowl exits.
Clyde looks into and enters busy second lobby. He notices busboys/pastry assistants going into Empire Room. Clyde follows them.

Hi. I’m calling from Dr. Bob’s Grief Seminars. Dr. Bob’s. Yes. Is this Mr. Pendecker? Did you get Dr. Bob’s flyer on the upcoming seminar in Phoenix? Uh-huh. Uh-huh.

Someone's getting the bonus. Lucy walks to the open office door to Dr. Bob’s office. D Bob dips into view as he gives Lucy a quick congratulator hug. At the same time, he looks over at Connie, strugglin the phone.

Well, Dr. Bob's not here, right this minute, but I...

(repeats it quietly) Gimme the credit card.

Another peek at the website might help with the calls. Get you familiar with what we do. (moving on) Night, night. Dr. Bob heads out and down the hall to leave the mortuary

INT. DR. BOB’S OFFICE, BASEMENT AREA - DAY 15 Connie is watching the Dr. Bob website on a computer. The office is decorated with Dr. Bob’s prominent memberships various national councils related to his profession, degr certificates, etc. Family pictures on his desk.
